data.title: Turner Classic Movies will honor Debbie Reynolds with 24-hour film tribute
data.meta_description: Turner Classic Movies will celebrate actress Debbie Reynolds with a 24-hour film festival of her work on Friday, Jan. 27.Reynolds, who was born in...
data.text:
Turner Classic Movies will celebrate actress Debbie Reynolds with a 24-hour film festival of her work on Friday, Jan. 27.

Reynolds, who was born in El Paso, died Dec. 28 at 84 years old. She died of a stroke while planning the funeral of her daughter, actress-writer-icon daughter Carrie Fisher. Fisher died the day before of a heart attack at the age of 60.

Advertisement

Advertisement

The memorial marathon will include Reynolds' only Oscar nomination, the title role in The Unsinkable Molly Brown (1964). It will air at 8 p.m.

News Roundups

Catch up on the day's news you need to know.

Or with:

By signing up you agree to our Terms of Service and Privacy Policy

Unsinkable will follow her breakthrough performance in 1952's Singin' in the Rain, which saw her dance with legendary hoofer Gene Kelly.

The movies will kick off at 6 a.m. Friday, Jan. 27, with It Started With a Kiss (1959).

Advertisement

The list includes: How the West Was Won (1963); The Tender Trap (1955); and The Singing Nun (1965).

The tribute will end at 4 a.m. Saturday, Jan. 28, with How Sweet It Is (1968.)

For more TV news, views and reviews, follow @DawnBurkes on Twitter.
